document_name: Annex I - Description of the action.pdf

outputs.output_descr:
The Reinforcement of Local Democracy II  LOD II is a continuation of the LOD I phase, with intention to strengthen cooperation between civil society organizations (CSO) and local administration. 

The project works with 15 selected partner local self-government units (municipalities and cities) and  is focused to institutionalize the collaboration between two sectors, in order  to generate unified and transparent mechanism for municipal fund disbursement foreseen for project-based approach, encourage and educate CSO to specialize and/or professionalize their services and act in accordance to local development strategies. Improved service delivery in local communities and capacities of local authorities will additionally be strengthened through forming and training of monitoring teams for CSOs,   while the capacities of CSOs will be strengthened through trainings focused on skills in Project Cycle Management. 

LOD II will give power to local partners and enhance community based-activities ensuring inclusiveness and participation of the stakeholders at the same time improving service delivery in line with local priorities. 

The Project works with the following 15 municipalities in the implementation of LOD II: Bijeljina, Derventa, Foča, Grad Sarajevo, Gradiška, Jablanica, Ključ, Ljubuški, Prijedor, Tešanj, Trebinje, Tuzla, Srebrenik, Zvornik and Zavidovići, and, at the same time, partners with the Ministry of Justice BiH, the Associations of Cities and Municipalities of FBiH and RS, and other CSOs.
A Framework to support Social Inclusion/Social Services in BiH developed

This project seeks, in an innovative manner, to take advantage of a unique constellation of opportunities and incentives currently in SEE countries, that would enable them to fulfil international obligations pertaining to the UN Convention on Rights of Persons with Disabilities, significantly converge on a key area of EU policy and the Acquis, and deliver both social and economic benefits to the region. 
The opportunities are both to decisively promote eAccessibility and to significantly enhance access to public services (eServices) to poor people and marginalised communities; while the incentives come from the obligations of the UN Convention on Rights of Persons with Disabilities, the EU Acquis recently extended to these areas, and the offer of additional EU funding across a number of programmes and policies. 
The project builds on the existing eSEE Agenda+ and the region-wide network of experienced eLeaders, with several years experience working together, to move decisively towards supporting the implementation of actual policies and actions within and between SEE countries.  Because of the context the budget is expected to catalyse and leverage significantly more resources, yielding a perceptible difference in SEE countries for those with disabilities and marginalised people and communities to access and to use eServices to meet their goals

project_descr: Social Inclusion Award-State/entity/municipalities/local development organizations in selected municipalities have increased capacity to plan and implement policies for sustainable, inclusive local economic development and poverty reduction
